titleStmt.title: Description of Special Collections Research Center, (SPC) MSS BH 100 COCH: Volume of works by Nicole Oresme, Maffeo Vegio, and Jordanus von Osnabrück

notesStmt.note: Scribe's name in abbreviated form is at the end of De moneta (fol. 34r)

Faye, C.U., continued and edited by W.H. Bond, Supplement to the Census of Medieval and Renaissance Manuscripts in the United States and Canada (New York: Bibliographical Society of America, 1962), p. 473, no. 9.
Iter Italicum, Vol. 5: Alia itinera III and Italy III, edited by Paul Oskar Kristeller (Leiden: E. J. Brill, 1990), p. 369.

msIdentifier.collection: Harry C. Cochran History of Business Collection

msContents.summary: This manuscript is a collection of treatises, mostly in dialogue form, including Maffeo Vegio's Philalethes (probably the latest work in the collection, no earlier than the second quarter of the fifteenth century); a dialogue between an English and a French soldier; Nicole Oresme's De moneta; Jordanus von Osnabrück's De imperio; and a dispute between a cleric and a soldier, an anonymous work of the late thirteenth century. The manuscript was copied in this form by the priest Johannes Verscane, possibly in Germany, between the second and fourth quarters of the fifteenth century. These treatises were likely removed from a larger manuscript, as the first leaf is a singleton with a catchword pointing to the first full quire beginning with the second leaf.

msItem.title: Volume of works by Nicole Oresme, Maffeo Vegio, and Jordanus von Osnabrück
msItem.author: Oresme, Nicole, approximately 1320-1382
Vegio, Maffeo, 1406 or 1407-1458
Jordanus von Osnabrück 12..-12.

msItem.title: Contentio inter Anglum et Francum milites
Tractatus de imperio (Jordanus von Osnabrück)
msItem.explicit: Qui est benedictus in secula seculorum. Amen. [fol. 43v]

supportDesc.extent: i+50+i; 207 x 140 mm bound to 215 x 150 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Modern foliation in pencil, upper right recto

layoutDesc.layout: Single column of thirty-six lines; frame-ruled in lead with double horizontal bounding lines; pricking visible on most leaves; written area: 165 x 92 mm

decoDesc.decoNote: Occasional red initials, two to five lines high, marking the beginnings of works or major textual divisions; red underlining and paragraph marks and initials touched in red throughout

binding.p: Modern half vellum with blue boards; spine title, Vegii et Oremi aliorumque tractatus, in black or brown ink

history.provenance: Purchased by Temple University from H. P. Kraus in 1955

keywords.term: Church and state -- Holy Roman Empire
Holy Roman Empire -- History -- House of Luxemburg, 1308-1437
